[File: src/traits.rs] [Struct: PartyState] [Low: Nonce Zero] Can the nonce field be deserialized as a zero Nonce, causing signature generation to produce invalid or zero signature shares?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Struct: PartyState] [Critical: Deserialization Attack] Can malicious JSON/binary data be crafted to deserialize PartyState with extremely large private_keys vectors, causing memory exhaustion DoS?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Struct: SignerState] [Critical: Group Key Manipulation] Can the group_key Point be deserialized as the identity point, causing all signature verifications to succeed trivially?

[File: src/traits.rs] [Struct: SignerState] [Critical: Group Key Manipulation] Can group_key be set to an attacker-controlled point that doesn't match the sum of polynomial commitments, enabling signature forgery?
